snippet: Dokes used his punishing fists to become the world heavyweight boxing champion in 1982 and, 15 years later, to beat his girlfriend so savagely that he was convicted of attempted murder.
abstract: Michael Dokes, former world heavyweight boxing champion who was later convicted of attempted murder, dies at age 54.
lead_paragraph: Dokes used his punishing fists to become the world heavyweight boxing champion in 1982 and, 15 years later, to beat his girlfriend so savagely that he was convicted of attempted murder.

headline.seo: Michael Dokes, Larger-Than-Life Heavyweight Boxer, Dies at 54
headline.main: Michael Dokes, Larger-Than-Life Heavyweight Boxer, Dies at 54
headline.print_headline: Michael Dokes, 54, a Champ Who Lived Big and Fell Hard
